title: [BUG] Mlflow runs do not persist across files

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
### Issues Policy acknowledgement

- [X] I have read and agree to submit bug reports in accordance with the [issues policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md)

### Willingness to contribute

No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### MLflow version

- Client:  1.30.0
- Tracking server:  1.30.0


### System information

- ** macOS 12.6.1 **:
- **Python3.10**:


### Describe the problem

I'm currently using Papermill to run my notebooks in a loop, and I want to save artifacts to a single run, but a new run is created in the notebook each time. 

`set_experiment` appears to be required, as it will default to experiment 0 which would cause mlflow to crash, since I deleted the default experiment. 

### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

```py
if __name__ == '__main__':
    mlflow.set_tracking_uri('http://127.0.0.1:5000')
    mlflow.set_experiment(f'Validation')

    mlflow.start_run(run_name="First Trial")
  
    for i in range(3):
        pm.execute_notebook(
            'model_train.ipynb',
            '/dev/null',
            parameters = dict(i=3)
        )
```

Then inside `model_train.ipynb`, I have in the cell:
```py
import mlflow
mlflow.set_experiment(f'Validation')
...
mlflow.log_figure(fig, f"myfig_{i}.png")
```

### Stack trace

Not applicable

### Other info / logs

_No response_
